results.title: Rugrats in Paris: the movie = Rugrats II
results.creator_credit: MFP Munich Film Partners GmbH, GmbH and Co, Rugrats Production KG, Arlene Klasky, Gabor Csupo, Paul Demeyer and Stig Bergqvist
results.brief_description: When Angelica catches a few scenes from the “The Godfather” on television, she takes it upon herself to become the Bubfather and grants wishes to her fellow Rugrats. Chuckie’s wish is to have a new mother. Not long after, Stu Pickles receives an emergency call to travel to Europetarland, France, to repair a faulty Raptor and pacify rampaging theme park director, Coco LaBouche. He’s invited to bring family and friends for company and the Rugrats find themselves in Paris. In an effort to gain a promotion and become company president, the child hating Coco makes a play for Chuckie’s hapless father Chas in a desperate attempt to win favour with the outgoing President. Only Angelica knows of Coco’s cunning plan and it’s up to the Rugrats to save Chas, imperilling a few famous landmarks along the way. Humorous throughout, the film has a strong sense of familial values and what constitutes “good” parenting. Features the voices of Susan Sarandon, John Lithgow, Debbie Reynolds, Christine Cavanaugh, Elizabeth Daily and Cheryl Chase.

results.title: Rugby Union football
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions and Bill Latto
results.brief_description: A description of the fundamental principles of the game of Rugby Union Football. Filmed at Twickenham with the clubs of Richmond and Rosslyn Park, this is a visual explanation of the laws and the skills of the game in a manner which will be helpful to referees, players and spectators.

results.title: Rugby rouses me
results.creator_credit: Motion Picture Associates, Film Australia, Peter Johnson, John Leake, David E. Barrow and Peter Fletcher
results.brief_description: Explores the game of Rugby in Australia at many levels and reveals the dedication, even fanaticism that Rugby engenders alike in players, organisers and supporters. Follows the stages of junior competition, selection trials, state and international competition. Also shows the camaraderie and life-long friendships that are built up amongst the players.

constellations_other.name: Dancing on a dream
constellations_other.description: Mechanical lantern slides called chromotropes created wondrously complex patterns of light through sliding glass panels and internal gears.

results.title: Rue des Prairies = Meadows Street
results.creator_credit: Alexandre Mnouchkine and Denys de la Patelliere
results.brief_description:
At the end of World War II, Henri, returns from a POW camp to his three children. Life as a widowed father proves very challenging for Henri as the children seem to either get into trouble or turn against their father.

Credits: Producer, Alexandre Mnouchkine ; director, Denys de la Patelliere ; writer, Michel Audiard ; photography, Louis Page ; music, Georges van Parys.
Cast: Marie-Jose Nat, Jean Gabin, France Asselin, Roger Dumas, Claude Brasseur, Leon Zitrone.

results.title: Rue Cases-Negres = Black Shack Alley = Sugar Cane Alley
results.creator_credit: Michel Loulergue, Alex Regis and Euzhan Palcy
results.brief_description:
Martinique-born Palcy, in her first feature, portrays some of the realities of colonialism. Although set in the 1930s the position of the dispossessed is little changed despite the evolution of the political situation as the economy remains in the hands of Martinique-born whites. The story, based on the novel by a black writer from the island, centers on a young boy from a cane-cutter’s village and his grandmother who works hard to provide him with an education as the means of breaking out of the cycle of poverty. The third main character is an old man who tells the boy the history of his people. Awards: Venice Film Festival (1983) Best Actress for Darling Legitmus ; French Academy of Cinema (Cesar) 1983: Best First Film for director Euzhan Palcy.

Credits: Producer, Michel Loulergue, Alex Regis ; director, writer, Euzhan Palcy ; photography, Dominique Chapuis ; music, Malavoi.
Cast: Garry Cadenat, Darling Legitmus, Douta Seck.

results.title: Rudyard Kipling's How the elephant got his trunk (K)
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Ed Newmann
results.brief_description: Based on Rudyard Kipling’s classic fable in the “Just So Stories” series, this beautifully presented story in claymation tells of a young elephant who learns the price and reaps the rewards of curiosity. When the elephant asks the crocodile what he has for dinner, the crocodile clamps the elephant’s stubby nose in his teeth. Pulling away, the elephant finds his nose is stretched completely out of shape - but to his surprise he discovers the long trunk is useful in a number of ways.

results.title: Rudyard Kipling's How the elephant got his trunk
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow Productions, Nick Bosustow and Lee Mishkin
results.brief_description: An animated film based on a story from the “Just So Stories” by Rudyard Kipling. A curious elephant calf sets out to find what the crocodile has for dinner. The crocodile attacks and in his effort to escape the elephant finds his nose somewhat elongated.
